intro: Guatteria montis-trinitatis, commonly known as the Trinidad mountain guatteria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, specifically found in Trinidad and Tobago. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
